content.description: Sit start at the right arete of the lichen boulder with feet under a small roof, left hand in a small sloped pocket an right in a sloping dish above the small roof. Pull on and slap out left to slopers, throw the right heel up, and then traverse left through several slopers into good edges, trailing the right heel behind you, until you get a left hand sidepull/undercling that you can use to shift your feet over to the left side of the boulder, from here you can link into and finish the Lichen Crack.
content.location: Starts on the right arete of the Lichen Boulder, traverses in left into the Lichen Crack.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the crack, optional though likely not necessary knee bar available for the start move, match hands in the crack, pull on and make one move up and left to the large jug shelf in the middle of the wall. From here, adjust your feet and then either lay back or slot a hand jam to shift your body up above the shelf you were just holding. Once standing comfortably on the shelf lay back the last move or two to get yourself up to the lip and a well featured topout.
content.location: Middle face of the Lichen Boulder, sitting at the base of the obvious crack.

content.description: Sit start with both hands matched on the shelf, go up with the right hand to a small crimp, bring your feet up, bump the left hand up to a blunt portion of the arete and then you can stand up to a good hold on the lip with the right hand. Easy topout.
content.location: Left arete of the Lichen Boulder, starts on the obvious shelf on the left arete at ~hip height.

content.description: This small boulder hosts several fun, if not lowball, lines. The most notable being those using the large crack/jam feature in the middle of the face.
